item.title: Role list suggestion/need
item.dc:creator: Ellie
item.description:
Most of the time in ToS, unless you’re calling someone out on day 1/2 or they have another lead, the town is going to believe you as Sheriff. The only defense people have is that the accuser is lying or that they got framed. Honestly I think the ability is kinda pointless. If they execute the person and you’re right, then you’re pretty much revealed anyways. The odds of someone being framed early on are pretty slim, since the BR has to convert the Psychic. So we’ll probably end up replacing it with an ability that’s more useful.

item.title: Role list suggestion/need
item.dc:creator: Ellie
item.description:
The King is always revealed. Making it so he has the possibility of being neutral or BR prevents the issue ToS has, where the Mayor can control the game. I’ve had too many games ruined by troll Mayors and the people that follow them blindly. Also it will prevent the BR from having to focus on killing the King right off the bat, since he can be one of them.

item.title: Role list suggestion/need
item.dc:creator: Ellie
item.description:
At the moment the King, Mastermind, Assassin, and Sheriff will be in every game. Also the Paladin will appear if the Cult spawns. In a full game of 15, there would likely be 2-4 neutrals, and the rest would be Blue Dragon. We haven’t decided on how exactly we’re going to do the class assignment.
It might be pseudo-random, where at least one of every class type in the Blue Dragon exists, but there would be a cap on how many of a specific type show up. I’m not a big fan of Classic in ToS, I feel like it gives too much information to the Town. All Any is just too random, and it’s usually pretty hard to win as Town. I’d like to strike a balance between the two, so that you’re not seeing the same thing every game, but still have it so every faction has a good chance of winning.
